59be9e0f-1aa1-4690-8dfd-611a44527ca6.description: The online teaching essentials badge is issued to those who successfully complete the 4 week, fully online, Online Teaching Essentials course. This course is the main vehicle for certifying St. John’s faculty to teach an online or hybrid course.
59be9e0f-1aa1-4690-8dfd-611a44527ca6.name: Online Teaching Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners will be able to:  Discuss the differences between teaching online, hybrid, and face-to-face Develop course and module level goals and objectives using Bloom’s Taxonomy. Align your online/hybrid teaching and assessment strategies with your course and module level goals. Create a research-based, pedagogically sound online/hybrid teaching strategy. Select online/hybrid assessments that best measure the learning of your student population.

443008ef-3a3a-49cd-bd6b-5e5f61fbcce2.description: The earner has completed an American Bar Association-approved paralegal studies program at St. John’s University in New York. By doing so, the earner has demonstrated competency in & a basic understanding of: legal research, writing & analysis; litigation procedure; rules governing the practice of law, including confidentiality, billing & time keeping, the prohibition against the unauthorized practice of law; & in how rights are created, prosecuted & maintained in multiple legal practice areas.
443008ef-3a3a-49cd-bd6b-5e5f61fbcce2.name: Paralegal Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of an American Bar Association-approved Paralegal Studies Program.

83a10a51-4991-4f8d-9c8c-7163115cd553.description: Through successful completion of graduate-level psychology courses, the badge earner has demonstrated skill and knowledge in the area of statistical design, experimental psychology, and laboratory techniques. The earner has demonstrated mastery in psychological measurement and scaling.
83a10a51-4991-4f8d-9c8c-7163115cd553.name: Behavioral Research Methods

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete PSY 603 Statistical Design in Research (3 credits)
Successfully complete PSY 604 Psychology Laboratory (3 credits)
Successfully complete PSY 659 Psychological Measurement and Scaling (3 credits)

5cdd7434-d976-4a25-8741-ec9901bd1dca.description: The Global Online Learning Exchange (GOLE) badge is issued to those who successfully complete the 2- to 3-week, online virtual exchange workshop. This course is the main vehicle for certifying St. John’s faculty to create an international virtual exchange with a professor from an institution outside the U.S.
5cdd7434-d976-4a25-8741-ec9901bd1dca.name: Global Online Learning Exchange (GOLE)

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners will be able to: Discuss the nature and benefits of international virtual exchange for faculty members and their students.  Collaborate with an international peer to develop a course that embeds a virtual exchange in a pedagogically sound way.
Badge earners will be able to: Collaborate with an international peer to develop a course that embeds a virtual exchange in a pedagogically sound way.

Badge earners will be able to: Create learning objectives—tied to both activities and student projects/deliverables—that measure both cross-cultural learning and engagement with the course’s “usual” discipline-based outcomes.

Badge earners will be able to: Ensure that learning objectives build sequentially, through scaffolding, and that they encourage higher-level skills, using Bloom’s taxonomy to conceptualize appropriate outcomes.

Badge earners will be able to: Collaborate across cultural and logistical differences, including languages, time zones, differences in academic disciplines and pedagogical approaches, and technological challenges.

Badge earners will be able to: Use technology to join students in synchronous and asynchronous modes across countries, by way of ensuring that they can meet course outcomes and engage in informal peer-to-peer interaction.

2805f5cb-6afa-4585-9c15-adbcf3b189d2.description: Through successful completion of graduate-level psychology courses, the badge earner has demonstrated expertise in the area of assessment methods for students with autism spectrum disorders, including knowledge of the techniques of applied behavior analysis.

ba424d15-f49d-4117-872d-fa7fc6526ca9.description: The advanced online teaching strategies badge is issued to those who successfully complete the 3 week, fully online, Advanced Online Teaching Strategies course. This course builds upon Online Teaching Essentials by addressing critical areas of online teaching including engagement and interaction, active learning, and authentic assessment.
ba424d15-f49d-4117-872d-fa7fc6526ca9.name: Advanced Online Teaching Strategies

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners will be able to:  Express the significance of building student engagement and interaction in online/hybrid courses. Discuss the value of presence and community to create successful online courses. Develop instructional strategies for creating engagement and building community online including the use of active learning.

Badge earners will be able to: Examine technology tools to increase engagement & interaction in online/hybrid courses. Evaluate, analyze, and develop tools and strategies to create engaging, active, and authentic learning activities/assessments. Create a plan for implementing an engaging learning activity suitable for the online/hybrid environment. Integrate research-based assessment strategies in your online courses.

a9622a78-55a2-4336-abcb-9d92788f7095.description: Corrections involves the supervision of persons arrested for, convicted of, or sentenced for criminal offenses. Overall, corrections can be viewed within the context of two major categories: institutional corrections and community corrections. In obtaining this badge, students will learn how correctional institutions operate and how community corrections offenders are supervised within their environments. Emphasis may be placed on specific offender populations, based on the student's interest.
a9622a78-55a2-4336-abcb-9d92788f7095.name: Corrections

badge_template_activities.title: CRJ 2004 American Corrections Systems - Complete with a grade of C or better
CRJ 3105 Juveniles in the Criminal Justice System - Complete with a grade of C or better
CRJ 3003 Women in the Criminal Justice System - Complete with a grade of C or better

Pick one from the following and complete with a grade of C or better:  CRJ 3002 Minority Groups in the Criminal Justice System CRJ 3105 Juvenile in the Criminal Justice System CRJ 3003 Women in the Criminal Justice System

3e547434-1284-4954-ab78-6c6547e4ab8c.description: Criminal Investigations are a critical part of identifying and ultimately prosecuting perpetrators. Criminal investigations lead to the collection of items or knowledge, that help investigators determine an outcome related to a goal. The three elements of criminal investigations include, the process, crime related information, and goals of the investigation. Criminal investigations are imperative to bring perpetrators of crimes to justice.
3e547434-1284-4954-ab78-6c6547e4ab8c.name: Criminal Investigations

badge_template_activities.title: CRJ 2007 Crime Scene Investigations - Completed with a grade of C or better
CRJ 3101 Criminal Investigations - Completed with a grade of C or better
CRJ 3210 Fraud in the Public Sector - Completed with a grade of C or better

d8f241c2-c25b-4627-8601-2ea101151017.description: Forensic science utilizes existing scientific methods to examine crime and its evidence to provide information on perpetrators and the causes of crimes. As a field, forensic science involves the application of sound science knowledge and processes to understand a crime scene and examine evidence. Forensics is a critical component of the criminal justice system and its inner-workings.
d8f241c2-c25b-4627-8601-2ea101151017.name: Criminal Justice - Forensics

badge_template_activities.title: CRJ 3103 Introduction to Forensic Science - complete with a grade of C or better
CRJ 3102 Forensic Psychology - complete with a grade of C or better
CRJ 5203 Criminalistics - complete with a grade of C or better

74b562d0-362b-47a5-87a6-1a3e7dcf5b89.description: Cybercrime involves the use of a computer, the Internet, and a network to perpetrate criminal activity. In earning this badge, students will learn what cybercrime is, how it is perpetrated, methods of cybercrime investigation, and legal implications and consequences of cybercrime.
74b562d0-362b-47a5-87a6-1a3e7dcf5b89.name: Cybercrime

badge_template_activities.title: CRJ 2006 Introduction to Cybercrime - Complete with a grade of C or better

CRJ 3118 Cyber Investigations - Complete with a grade of C or better

8f38c5cd-a866-4756-b2c4-620bd043d945.description: Effective police leadership is imperative for supervision of today's police officers. 10a65003-4ca8-44f1-9d88-52c5f15e0288.description: Through successful completion of the secure coding related courses, the badge earner has demonstrated expertise in demonstrating common security-related coding vulnerabilities with defenses. Topics include secure coding in multiple languages with deeper understandings of cryptography, memory management, and security code review skills. The badge earner can also describe the secure software development lifecycle (sSDLC), work in team environments, and communicate effectively on security topics.
10a65003-4ca8-44f1-9d88-52c5f15e0288.name: Secure Coding
